overview: From 2025-12-23 to 2025-12-24, elizaos-plugins/plugin-discord had 4 new PRs (3 merged), 0 new issues, and 3 active contributors.

topPRs.title: Add multi-bot voice architecture with audio channels and progressive updates
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
> [!NOTE]
> Adds major Discord plugin capabilities and integrations with music broadcast architecture.
> 
> - Multi-bot support via `DiscordClientRegistry` with token validation, per-bot `VoiceManager`, WORLD_CONNECTED emission, and cleanup APIs; new tests for simulcast/independent routing
> - Progressive updates: new `ProgressiveMessage` helper and `MessageManager` edits-in-place with 60s TTL, throttling/debouncing, and graceful fallback; unit tests included
> - Audio contracts and channels: introduce `IAudioSink` (plus `DiscordAudioSink` export), `audioChannels` (TTS/MUSIC/SFX/AMBIENT with priorities/ducking), and `audioState` provider; environment adds voice duck/threshold/ramp settings
> - New actions: `SET_VOICE_CHANNEL_STATUS` and `SET_LISTENING_ACTIVITY` with parsing prompts and Discord service calls; added `VOICE_STATUS_FEATURES.md`
> - README expanded (progressive updates, multi-channel audio, sink integration); added architecture docs (`MUSIC_ARCHITECTURE.md`, `COORDINATION_PATTERNS.md`, `PROGRESSIVE_UPDATES.md`)
> - Tests: message manager, voice manager pipeline, token validation, progressive message behavior, multibot simulcast/independent scenarios
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 693f58a098411051a26b23bfa4c15afdb3b64e01. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

## Release Notes

* **New Features**
  * Progressive message updates for real-time status on long-running operations
  * Multi-channel audio system with priority-based mixing (TTS, Music, SFX, Ambient)
  * Voice channel status management capability
  * Bot listening activity control
  * Multi-bot orchestration support
  * Audio sink abstraction for voice playback

* **Documentation**
  * Added comprehensive guides for coordination patterns, music architecture, and progressive updates
  * Added voice status features documentation

* **Tests**
  * Added test coverage for multi-bot scenarios, progressive messaging, audio routing, and voice management

<sub>✏️ Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.</sub>

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: fix: resolve TypeScript type errors with typed event handlers
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
## Summary - Add `DiscordRegisterCommandsPayload` interface extending `EventPayload` - Use generic type in `registerEvent` for `DISCORD_REGISTER_COMMANDS` - Fix `useModel` transcription call to pass `Buffer` instead of `File` - Fix `serverMessageId` instead of `serverId` on actions - Linting ## Dependencies ⚠️ **Requires https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/pull/6277 to be merged first** This PR uses the new generic type support for `registerEvent

()` added in the core PR. ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * Introduced DiscordRegisterCommandsPayload interface for Discord command registration with enhanced configuration capabilities, including channel permission control. * **Chores** * Version bumped to 1.3.6. * Code style and formatting refinements across type definitions and modules for improved consistency. ✏️ Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.

topPRs.title: fix: use messageServerId instead of deprecated serverId
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
## Summary
- Replace all usages of `room?.serverId` with `room?.messageServerId` in Discord action files
- Uses the correct UUID-based server identifier from core

## Files changed
- getUserInfo.ts
- joinChannel.ts
- leaveChannel.ts
- readChannel.ts
- searchMessages.ts
- sendDM.ts
- serverInfo.ts
I did some lint too

topPRs.title: Add permission system and enhance server/message fallback handling
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
> [!NOTE]
> • **Reactions**: Implement fast-path emoji extraction from agent responses, explicit-request detection, and LLM fallback; refined emoji normalization and quieter failures when auto-reacting (`reactToMessage.ts`).
> 
> • **Channel reads/search**: More robust channel resolution by name with server checks and clearer user errors when server context is missing (`readChannel.ts`, `searchMessages.ts`).
> 
> • **Banner**: Improved ANSI-safe padding/truncation, clearer status labeling (custom/default/unset/required), and better value masking/formatting (`banner.ts`).
> 
> • **Permissions**: Export numeric permission tiers for invite URL generation, documenting BigInt→Number conversion considerations (`permissions.ts`).
> 
> • **Service API**: Expose text channel `topic` in room metadata and add `getChannelTopic(channelId)` for fresh topic retrieval (`service.ts`).
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 4385e67b2ee33cffa7d615a4d8c9eb2a494f234a. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Channel topic info is now exposed via the service API for plugins and syncs.

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Faster, more reliable emoji reaction extraction with explicit-request detection and graceful silent skip.
  * Improved channel resolution and server-guarding for message reads and searches.
  * Settings banner rendering refined to preserve special characters and correct visible-length truncation.

* **Documentation**
  * Permission docs updated to note numeric conversion considerations for URL compatibility.

<sub>✏️ Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.</sub>
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
